nodes.bodyText:
If this fits in best with the scenario we can use it technically.
However cocoMDS1 is for 'data lake operations', whilst cocoMDS4 is for 'data lake users. It seems the latter ie original value is preferable.
If there are additional OMASs needed for cocoMDS4 then I think we should look at changing the configuration there rather than pointing the UI to the inappropriate server?

nodes.bodyText:
What OMASs does the UI use for the queries you want to demo?
I would presume the data engine OMAS is only used by the data processing engine for feeding events about sources of data/lineage into Egeria. As such I would expect that API to be needed for the events (so possibly from the notebook if you are demoing that way.. and hence going against cocoMDS1), but the UI itself would be using other OMASs? And it is THEY, not data engine, that would be supported on cocoMDS4
But I don't know enough about the design of lineage? Hence the question?

This the only way we have at the moment to load data. Those events is this file https://github.com/odpi/egeria/blob/master/open-metadata-resources/open-metadata-deployment/sample-data/coco-pharmaceuticals/payloads/omrs-cohort-ibm-igc.txt
Yes they are coming from IGC but are mapped to the Open metadata Types so they are result from the mapper.
We cannot load from an archive or use an API ( at least I don't know if we have that option) since we need to produce events to fill egeria graph which is the only one in the cohort with this test scenario.

I am concerned due to a) Reference to a proprietary solution b) the opaqueness of using an internal messaging format to the end user, and setting a bad precedent that it is a supported mechanism.
At a minimum I think we need to discuss this on a call, but as per Graham's comment above, I think it should be possible, clear, and setting the correct precedent, by showing how to do things using the APIs.

nodes.bodyText: I'm uncomfortable with only referring to IGC as the example. We need a generic version ... and I think it's then ok to also add IGC specific, but IGC only sends the wrong message IMO about being open - at least if this is in the 'core' project (as opposed to other sandpit/3rd party repos?)

nodes.bodyText: The primary reason why these mock events are being used is that they enable us to quickly demonstrate asset lineage in a follow-up tutorial, as we already have the right data for that. Do you think for the short term it is fine to leave the IGC part here, and add other sources in the future?

As a result, the data lake has to be\n", + "designed to handle a wide variety of data, including some highly sensitive and regulated data.\n", + "\n", + "In this lab we use first create some assets. Afterwards, the UI where we can search for assets is shown. This varies depending on whether you are running them locally, through **docker-compose** or on **kubernetes**." + ] + }, + { + "cell_type": "code", + "execution_count": null, + "metadata": {}, + "outputs": [], + "source": [ + "%run ../common/environment-check.ipynb" + ] + }, + { + "cell_type": "markdown", + "metadata": {}, + "source": [ + "----\n", + "Callie is using the data lake metadata server called `cocoMDS4`.
